text: The Our Lady of Penha Chapel (; ) is a church in São Lourenço, Macau, China. ==History== The land where the church stands was donated by the Senate of the Augustinians for the construction of the church, which was dedicated to the Our Lady of Penha of France. The church was then constructed in 1622 and became the property of the Augustinians until 1834 when they were expelled from Macau. In 1837, the church was reconstructed along with the Bishop residence next to it. In 1935, it was then again completely rebuilt. ==Location== The church is located at the top of Penha Hill. Our Lady of Penha Chapel ==Architecture== At the front courtyard of the church stands the Our Lady of Lourdes statue. At the steps of the hillside staircase exists the picturesque grotto of Our Lady of Lourdes. ==Opening time== The building complex is opened everyday from 9:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. and the chapel is opened everyday from 9:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. ==See also== * List of tourist attractions in Macau * Christianity in Macau ==References== ==External links== * Chapel of Our Lady of Penha – Macao Government Tourism Office website Category:Roman Catholic churches in Macau Category:1622 establishments in China Category:1622 establishments in the Portuguese Empire Category:17th- century establishments in Macau Category:Macau Peninsula Category:Roman Catholic chapels in China
